posts.post_content:
Reminds me of [Spellweaver Helix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellweaver Helix), but this enchantment appears to be much more awesome.  
Play two instant/sorcery spells which are already in your graveyard, and then just [Fork](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fork) every single subsequent one - hell yes!  
  
[Manamorphose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manamorphose) is a card i would definitely play with this. Effectively free, slightly shrinkens the deck in size, able to add quest counters and when copied provides two mana and a card.  
  
Some other good picks which might be played along with this are cards that become more powerful if other cards with the same name are in a graveyard - since you need to do that anyways in order to make use of Pyromancer's Ascention, which would be [Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame), [Kindle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kindle) or [Flame Burst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flame Burst), and when splashing blue [Acc-umulated Knowledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=21285), [Rune Snag](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune Snag) or [Æther Burst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Æther Burst). Feast of Flesh/a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Mode (9/26/2009 8:51:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card is just all around good for burn. It works even better in multiples, since the more you have on the battlefield, the more copies you get.  
  
It's good in standard with all of the red lovin' and even better in extended where it can have sick combo potential.  
  
@akrolsmir:  
As far as I can tell, Retrace will work with Pyromancer Ascension, but only if you have at least two in your graveyard. When you Retrace, you are casting from your graveyard. When you do that, the card leaves the graveyard and is put onto the stack where it becomes a spell. There's never a window in which a card with Retrace will be in your graveyard and on the stack as a cast spell simultaneously. I could be wrong, but I don't think you can exploit it like that.
posts.html:

It's good in standard with all of the red lovin' and even better in extended where it can have sick combo potential.

@akrolsmir:
As far as I can tell, Retrace will work with Pyromancer Ascension, but only if you have at least two in your graveyard. When you Retrace, you are casting from your graveyard. When you do that, the card leaves the graveyard and is put onto the stack where it becomes a spell. There's never a window in which a card with Retrace will be in your graveyard and on the stack as a cast spell simultaneously. I could be wrong, but I don't think you can exploit it like that.

posts.post_content:
Just played a game.  
  
2 charged pyromancers on the field by turn 5.  
cast [manamorphose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=manamorphose) get 3 cards and 6 mana back  
play a land just drawn  
tap all 3 remaining lands  
play [elemental appeal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=elemental appeal) kicked  
3 14/1 trample haste creatures.  
  
It were a glorious victory and a good enough reason to rate this 5/5

posts.post_content:
IronShins:
  
As it was stated before - twincast or storm spells just make a copy, they don't make you cast the spell again. So no, you wouldn't get any quest counters for twincasting or forking any spell.
  
   
Still, I'm gonna play this marvel and twincast both together. It simply fits together, both cards can be used to bring some serious pain, and all you need is just another spell. Plus, imagine the fun when you have charged Pyromancer's ascension, cast lightning bolt AND then twincast - 12 damage for RUU, thank you, it was pleasure doin' bussiness.
  
   
What I don't like much about this ascension is the way it gets pumped, however. It somehow forces you not to pick particular spells, but quantity of them. That's gonna be 4x lightning bolt (hell, I'd play it 4x anyway), 4x Brainstorm, 4x... firebolt, probably. Firebolt is good alternative, perhaps, cause' you need only two to pump it up (altough by turn 5, you'll maybe have it up and running anyway).
  
   
As **XDaragoX** said, autocard... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: Does anyone else see this being rediculous with a kicked Rites of Replication? Or Conquer's Pledge? Or any of the rare-kicker instants? Or the more powerful traps? This thing screams crazy-combo potential, though the effect will be hard to get into play in varients where you are less likely to have multiple copies of the same spell (sealed deck, booster drafts, etc.) All in all. A powerful card.

posts.post_content:
**GreenManTenTons said:**  
*This + Twincast + Time Warp = Solitaire mode.*  
  
For a while that'd be true. 4 turns in a row, \*\*\*uming you already have Pyromancer active and you don't draw an additional Time Warp.  
  
On the other hand...  
  
1. Play Pyromancer  
2. Play [Call to Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call to Mind) (A) targeting arbitrary instant/sorcery  
3. Play Call to Mind (B) targeting Call to Mind (A) (1 counter on Pyromancer)  
4. Play Call to Mind (A) targeting Call to Mind (B) (2 counters on Pyromancer, Pyromancer is now active)  
5. Play [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp), Pyromancer duplicates it so that you get 2 more turns.  
6. Play Call to Mind (B) targeting Call to Mind (A), Pyromancer duplicates it so that you can also target Time Warp.  
7. Go to #4
posts.html:
GreenManTenTons said:
This + Twincast + Time Warp = Solitaire mode.

For a while that'd be true. 4 turns in a row, ***uming you already have Pyromancer active and you don't draw an additional Time Warp.

On the other hand...

1. Play Pyromancer
2. Play Call to Mind (A) targeting arbitrary instant/sorcery
3. Play Call to Mind (B) targeting Call to Mind (A) (1 counter on Pyromancer)
4. Play Call to Mind (A) targeting Call to Mind (B) (2 counters on Pyromancer, Pyromancer is now active)
5. Play Time Warp, Pyromancer duplicates it so that you get 2 more turns.
6. Play Call to Mind (B) targeting Call to Mind (A), Pyromancer duplicates it so that you can also target Time Warp.
7. Go to #4

posts.post_content:
As shown recently in a tournament, a good way to make this card into a good deck is to put a ton of cheap card drawing spells. This will quickly fill your graveyard while still keeping your hand relatively full. Stay afloat with mana leaks and/or bolts (maybe spreading seas too, or you could just use bursts instead with seas in the board. Depends on your meta) long enough until you can get a pyromancer ascension to stick. Once you play time warp with an active ascension it's really hard to lose.  
  
Be prepared to deal with any graveyard hate beyond the 1st game. Leyline of the void is really hard to deal with, but only if it's in the starting hand (if they hardcast it, it's 4 mana, you should be countering it). This makes your board very obvious as well; counters and bounces.  
  
The best part of this deck is that it's very cheap, relative to other top tier decks. The fetches are the most expensive cards, but fetches are a good investment so that's not a big deal, and you could do without t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
This is the worst.  
Not only is it obviously good 'n' helpful like the other ascensions (lol), but it has a not-so-subtle appeal to Spike in its design. There are people walking throughout English speaking countries with only 5 five words in their vocabulary: Lightning, Bolt, Burst, Pyromancer, and Ascension. First cascade, and then this. Obviously, when I was shopping on Ebay, four [Swift Silences](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=107284) were not enough. All I can hope for now is a more quick and efficient instant-kill combo (than 'lucky charms') so that no more other 'cool/creative ideas' are worth discussing.  
  
A better idea would be for Wizards to come out with an enchantment for ![Blue or Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=UR&type=symbol) that says "Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, that spell gains 'this spell deals 1 damage to target creature or player'. Then copy that spell 19 times."  
That card would awesome. I would immediately run 4 in my [Aura Finesse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=193599) deck.  
  
P.S. Did you kn... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
This is the worst.
Not only is it obviously good 'n' helpful like the other ascensions (lol), but it has a not-so-subtle appeal to Spike in its design. There are people walking throughout English speaking countries with only 5 five words in their vocabulary: Lightning, Bolt, Burst, Pyromancer, and Ascension. First cascade, and then this. Obviously, when I was shopping on Ebay, four Swift Silences were not enough. All I can hope for now is a more quick and efficient instant-kill combo (than 'lucky charms') so that no more other 'cool/creative ideas' are worth discussing.

A better idea would be for Wizards to come out with an enchantment for that says "Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, that spell gains 'this spell deals 1 damage to target creature or player'. Then copy that spell 19 times."
That card would awesome. I would immediately run 4 in my Aura Finesse deck.

posts.post_content:
Absolutely ridiculous if there're two counters on it when you cast [Time Spiral](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Spiral). Draw a fresh hand, unload instants and/or float mana and then wait for the second one to resolve and draw a third hand? It's great.   
  
What's that? You drew *another* Time Spiral with your third hand and [Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame)/[Manamorphose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manamorphose) to convert/add more mana to your pool and a fresh hand of burn spells?  
  
On the same note, once you've got two counters on it, try using [Fiery Temper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiery Temper) and having [Windfall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Windfall). Any [Fiery Temper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fiery Temper)s in your existing or second hand become [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)s.
posts.html:
Absolutely ridiculous if there're two counters on it when you cast Time Spiral. Draw a fresh hand, unload instants and/or float mana and then wait for the second one to resolve and draw a third hand? It's great.

What's that? You drew another Time Spiral with your third hand and Rite of Flame/Manamorphose to convert/add more mana to your pool and a fresh hand of burn spells?

On the same note, once you've got two counters on it, try using Fiery Temper and having Windfall. Any Fiery Tempers in your existing or second hand become Lightning Bolts.
